AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Materiais e Processos para Engenharia Aeronсutica e Aeroespacial

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O objetivo desta pesquisa щ propor uma abordagem sistemсtica para auxiliar a tomada de decisуo de fazer ou comprar, durante o desenvolvimento de produtos complexos. A abordagem proposta se insere no contexto de desenvolvimento integrado de produto na indњstria aeroespacial, considerando caracterэsticas deste tipo de produto e seus processos de ciclo de vida (e. g desenvolvimento, manufatura, verificaчуo e validaчуo). As decisѕes de fazer ou comprar sуo estratщgicas e podem resultar em vantagens competitivas. Este trabalho estuda o tipo de relacionamento entre empresa e fornecedor, suas respectivas vantagens e desvantagens, critщrios de influъncia na decisуo e sistemas de suporte. O trabalho tambщm analisa as decisѕes de casos reais, propѕe um modelo de processo decisѓrio e discute como estas decisѕes se encaixam no mщtodo. As conclusѕes sуo que o framework proposto contribui na anсlise do contexto do produto e da organizaчуo; na anсlise multidisciplinar sistemсtica da decisуo entre fazer ou comprar, atravщs de fluxograma de decisуo e na abordagem do relacionamento entre empresa e fornecedor.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The objective of this study is to propose a systematic and multidisciplinary approach to assist the Дmake or buyД decision-making process during complex product development. The approach is proposed within the context of integrated product development in the aerospace industry, considering product characteristics and product life cycle processes (e. g, development, manufacturing, verification and validation). ДMake or buyД decisions are strategic and may result in competitive advantages. This work studies the types of relationship between company and supplier, their advantages and disadvantages, criteria for influencing on the decision and support systems. The work also analyses Дmake or buyД decisions from real cases, proposes a decision making model and compares how decisions are applied in the method. The conclusions are that the proposed framework contributes to the analysis of the context of the product and the organization; to multidisciplinary systematic analysis of Дmake or buyД decision-making, through flowchart decision and to approach the relationship between company and supplier.

THE PROPOSAL OF TOTAL MISSION ANALYSIS FOR SPACE SYSTEM
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO-INGLES: THE PROPOSAL OF TOTAL MISSION ANALYSIS FOR SPACE SYSTEM

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This thesis presents a method for space system mission analysis. It is based on a new systems engineering approach namely ?Enhanced Total View Framework (ETVF)?, which seeks the concurrent development of the product and organizations involved. ETVF is also described in this thesis and as the name suggests it is an enhancement of the ?Total View Framework?. The proposed method for space system mission analysis is called ?Total Mission Analysis for Space System (TMASS)?. It takes into account all space system life cycle, from the time the space system is qualified for use or operation to the time it is decommissioned or disposed of. Indeed, TMASS encompasses all the high-level procedures before, during and after the space system launching and operational phases. It includes space system non-operational and operational processes, comprising the development of the whole system where the space system is inserted. TMASS is applied to the Mission Analysis of the SARA Suborbital System. The results obtained by using the traditional approach are briefly compared with the results obtained by using the proposed method. TMASS is supposed to be applied in the earlier phase of a space system development. In addition, ETVF and TMASS intents are also to revive the logic behind the systems engineering activity which with time has become only a formality.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: As organizaчѕes para desenvolvimento de sistemas espaciais no Brasil se comportam como se nуo houvesse conhecimento ou produtos anteriormente desenvolvidos. Este trabalho de doutorado pretende inserir no processo de desenvolvimento de produtos espaciais no Brasil a possibilidade de escalabilidade e discutir como isso afeta novos programas
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Space systems in Brazil have always been developed from scratch without formal consideration of carry over designs or previous experience. This work intends to formalize scalability in space products development in Brazil.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-.TITULO: DESENVOLVIMENTO INTEGRADO DE SISTEMAS ESPACIAIS ? DESIGN FOR AIT (PROJETO PARA MONTAGEM, INTEGRAЧУO E TESTE DE SATЩLITES)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: As atividades de Montagem, Integraчуo e Testes (AIT -―Assembly, Integration and Test‖) de um satщlite sуo uma seqќъncia lѓgica e inter-relacionada de eventos. O principal objetivo desta fase de desenvolvimento do programa espacial щ alcanчar um alto grau de confianчa que o satщlite estс em conformidade com os parтmetros de desempenho especificados. Verifica-se que as inter-relaчѕes do processo de AIT no desenvolvimento de sistemas espaciais complexos - satщlites, tanto na forma tradicional ou os que jс empregam a engenharia simultтnea, nуo contempla de forma adequada р participaчуo da AIT nas fases de concepчуo e detalhamento do projeto do satщlite. Contata-se que os custos envolvidos e o tempo que hoje se aloca para as atividades AIT correspondem acerca de 15% e 25% respectivamente, do total de um projeto espacial e que modelar vсrios aspectos de um sistema em seu ciclo de vida (nova visуo de projeto de sistema), oferece aumentos significativos de produtividade e qualidade do produto. Щ de fundamental importтncia, portanto inserir nos processos existentes de modelagem, que utilizam os benefэcios de Engenharia Simultтnea - "Model Driven System Design", aplicado aos projetos de sistemas espaciais, os requisitos de Montagem, Integraчуo e Testes (AIT) ao nэvel do sistema, desde a fase de concepчуo e detalhamento do projeto do satщlite. Isso significa desenvolver um processo para integrar os requisitos AIT ? elщtricos, mecтnicos e ambientais no desenvolvimento de satщlites - Design de AIT (D4AIT). Este programa de doutoramento tem por objetivo propor, um novo processo (D4AIT) de desenvolvimento de satщlites, que insira os requisitos (elщtricos, mecтnicos e ambientais) de montagem, integraчуo e testes (AIT -―Assembly, Integration and Test‖), em nэvel de sistema, jс na fase de concepчуo sistъmica de projeto do satщlite.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The Satellite Assembly, Integration and Test (AIT) activities are a logical and interrelated sequence of events. The main objective in this phase of a space program development is to achieve a high degree of confidence that the Satellite complies with its specified performance parameters. It is verified that the interrelations of the process of AIT in the development of complex space systems ? satellites, either in the traditional way or that already employ simultaneous engineering; it does not contemplate in an appropriate form the participation of AIT in the phases of conception and detailing of project of the satellite. Considering that the involved costs and the time currently placed for AIT activities correspond approximately 15% and 25% respectively of the total of a space project and that shaping multiple aspects of a system in its cycle of life, this new vision of system project, offers to dramatic profits of productivity and quality of product. It is of fundamental importance to insert in the existing processes of modeling that they use the benefits of Simultaneous Engineering - ―Model Driven System Design‖, applied to the Space Projects, the requirements of Assembly, Integration and Testes (AIT) at the system level, since the phase of conception and detailing of project of the satellite. This means to develop a process to integrate the AIT requirements ? electrical, mechanical and environmental to the satellite development - Design for AIT. This doctoral program aims to propose a new process of development of satellites, to include requirements - electrical, mechanical and environmental of assembly, integration and testing (AIT) of satellites, at the system level, already at the design stage of the satellite project.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho tem o objetivo de identificar as principais fontes de erro na estimativa do tamanho da histѓria usuсrio durante sprints de um projeto сgil. A introduчуo de prсticas сgeis no desenvolvimento de software exige uma nova abordagem para o planejamento, uma abordagem que suporta mudanчas constantes e de fato рs suporta, tornando a estimativa de requisitos ainda mais desafiadora. A medida em que mais empresas de desenvolvimento de software adotam o desenvolvimento сgil como motivador para os seus valores fundamentais, governanчa, planejamento, controle e garantia de qualidade deve ser refinada e fortalecida para levar a melhor previsibilidade e apoio р programaчуo em si. Este trabalho atende a essa necessidade, identificando fontes de erro na estimativa do tamanho das user stories em um sprint, relativamente trъs aspectos de um projeto сgil: a equipe, o produto e a empresa. A fim de encontrar estas fontes de erro, compara-se dois cenсrios de desenvolvimento сgil de software: um experimento acadъmico, que foi encontrado bem documentado na literatura, e um projeto em uma empresa privada, analisado usando estudo de caso como metodologia de pesquisa, conduzido pelo autor. O autor avalia quantitativamente a precisуo do tamanho de user stories em cada sprint, observando-se o erro relativo, р procura de um comportamento inesperado quando se compara o projeto da empresa com o experimento acadъmico apresentado. Membros da equipe do projeto foram entrevistados acerca de possэveis mudanчas que aconteceram na equipe de projeto, que potencialmente levaram ao aumento da magnitude do erro relativo do tamanho das user stories estimado em diferentes momentos do projeto. Os resultados do estudo de caso mostram que uma sщrie de fatores estуo relacionados ao aumento da magnitude do erro relativo do tamanho das user stories estimado em diferentes momentos do projeto, os principais fatores reportados pela Webgoal foram: mudanчas no escopo do projeto, o otimismo dos estimadore
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This work aims to identify the main sources of error on the estimation of user story?s size during sprints of an agile project. The introduction of agile practices in software development requires a new approach to planning, an approach that embraces change and in fact supports it, making estimation even more challenging. As more software development companies adopt agile development as rationale for their core values, governance, planning, control and quality assurance must be refined and strengthened to drive better predictability and support coding. This work addresses this need by identifying sources of error on the estimation of user story?s size in a sprint from basically three aspects of an agile project: the team, the product and the company. In order to find these sources of error, the author compares two scenarios of agile software development: an academic experiment, which was found well documented in the literature; and a project at a private company, analyzed using a single-case research methodology conducted by the author. The author assesses quantitatively the accuracy of user story?s size estimate for each sprint in a project, by observing its relative error, looking for an unexpected behavior when comparing the company?s project to the academic experiment. Following, the author interviewed the company?s project team about potential changes that affected the teamand potentially led to the increase in the magnitude of relative error of user story?s size estimate seen in different moments of the project. The author found that throughout the project different events led to high magnitude of relative error on estimation of user story?s size: changes in scope of the project, optimism, poor experience with agile practices, poor experience with estimation techniques and inefficient communication with the customer.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Aluna foi desligada pelo curso nas vesperas da defesa por nao ter obtido o numero de creditos suficientes para cumprir o criterio de numero minimo de creditos em disciplina. Havia duas disciplinas cursadas com notas inferiores a 8,0 o que nao pode ser aproveitado para credito. A aluna cursava o doutorado desde 2004, tendo passado por varios orientadores. Geilson orientou a aluna somente a partir de marco de 2011. A aluna passou pelo exame de qualificacao em agosto de 2011. Uma semana antes da defesa, marcada para 12 de dezembro de 2011, veio a informacao sobre a contagem de creditos. A aluna evoluiu a sua tese seguindo as orientaчoes do orientador e da banca de qualificacao mas era ainda necessario trabalho adicional na щpoca da defesa.
Na medida em que as redes de comunicaчѕes se multiplicam, unindo os quatro cantos do mundo, щ impossэvel pensar em projetos que de alguma forma nуo sejam internacionais. Este щ o caso das tecnologias espaciais que, embora, seja de alto carсter estratщgico e tecnolѓgico, tъm beneficiado inњmeros paэses atravщs dos projetos de cooperaчуo espacial internacional. Entretanto, щ fato que cooperaчуo entre Estados nуo se dс naturalmente, sуo sempre movidos por interesses distintos. Assim, tais projetos de cooperaчуo sуo sempre influenciados pelos seus ambientes, interesses e atores cuja interrelaчуo podem influenciar de maneira significativa os resultados do projeto. Assim, no entendimento de que a dinтmica ao longo de um projeto influem no sentido de que os ambientes e seus Stakeholders mudam, щ cada vez mais necessсrio um modelo de gestуo de projetos diferenciado, em que os gerentes de projeto possam visualizar tais relacionamentos e como eles podem influenciar para a ѓtima do projeto. Esta tese, entуo, apresenta um modelo de rede de Stakeholders para projetos de cooperaчуo espacial internacional, atravщs de uma releitura e adaptaчуo na integraчуo das teorias: Dependъncia de Frooman (1999) e da Saliъncia de Mitchell, Agle e Wood (1997)

A indњstria fictэcia que se propѕe serс chamada, ao longo do documento, de SoluSat (Soluчѕes em Satщlite), como nome provisѓrio para se referenciar de forma rсpida р empresa. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The systems engineering process has traditionally been used in the complex product development. However, once this does not possess a focused approach in the processes, it is difficult to determine how to integrate the life cycle process architectures of those products to the technical requirements. This deficiency of integration has also been observed in the international organisations ESA, NASA and USAF literature that, although, by means of the FFBD, Time Line and N2 diagrams, to develop the structure and behaviour models of their space products life cycle processes, do not explain how to relate the technical requirements to those models. In this way, it is considered in this thesis to use the IDEF and IDEF3 models for developing the structure and behaviour models of the systems engineering process approach focused in the life cycle processes, called here life cycle processes engineering. Once modelled that engineering, this thesis proposes to use those methods to develop the structure and behaviour models of the complex products life cycle processes and, by means of the Requirements Allocation Sheet, to integrate those models to the related technical requirements. As use the IDEF e IDEF3 methods, instead of the FFBD, Time Line and N2 diagrams, it is possible to characterize the processes in a trustworthy way, once the former methods feasible to integrate the structure and behavior of the processes. The conclusion in this thesis is that is possible to use the IDEF e IDEF3 methods to develop the models of the systems engineering process approach focused in the life cycle processes and, when using those methods in set with the Requirements Allocation Sheet, it is possible develop the structure and behaviour models of the complex products life cycle processes, integrated with the related technical requirements.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The objective of this study is to propose a systematic and multidisciplinary approach to assist the Дmake or buyД decision-making process during complex product development. The approach is proposed within the context of integrated product development in the aerospace industry, considering product characteristics and product life cycle processes (e. g, development, manufacturing, verification and validation). ДMake or buyД decisions are strategic and may result in competitive advantages. This work studies the types of relationship between company and supplier, their advantages and disadvantages, criteria for influencing on the decision and support systems. The work also analyses Дmake or buyД decisions from real cases, proposes a decision making model and compares how decisions are applied in the method. The conclusions are that the proposed framework contributes to the analysis of the context of the product and the organization; to multidisciplinary systematic analysis of Дmake or buyД decision-making, through flowchart decision and to approach the relationship between company and supplier.

Banca reunida em 20 de maio de 2011, as 15:30, na sala 35 do predio Beta do INPE. Banca presidida por Petronio, interno: Geilson, externo: Ghizoni, orientador: Marcelo.
A presente dissertaчуo apresenta e estuda uma proposta para a atualizaчуo do Segmento Espacial do Sistema Nacional de Dados Ambientais orientada pela Engenharia de Sistemas, com ъnfase em uma anсlise de cobertura de um sistema orbital de microssatщlites, nomeados SCD N, para coleta de dados ambientais oriundos de sinais provenientes de diversas plataformas no solo, para armazenс-los р bordo e retransmitэlos no instante adequado para estaчѕes de recepчуo em solo, compatэveis com o Sistema Nacional de Dados Ambientais (SINDA) jс implantado no Paэs pelo Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (INPE), o qual jс dispѕe de quase mil Plataformas de Coleta de Dados (PCD) espalhadas pelo territѓrio nacional. Sуo apresentados os requisitos de missуo: funcionais, operacionais e de interface. Sуo realizadas anсlises visando demonstrar as principais caracterэsticas do sistema em ѓrbita, como taxa temporal de visibilidade de uma plataforma no solo, tempo de visibilidade do satщlite por estaчѕes terrenas e tempo de revisita. Sуo realizados estudos para proporcionar a definiчуo do sistema orbital de SCDs N (definiчуo da quantidade de microssatщlites) de modo a ser capaz de adquirir dados de plataformas espalhadas em regiѕes do globo, bem como, de ser temporariamente visэvel, para efeito de telecomunicaчѕes, por estaчѕes terrenas posicionadas tambщm em regiѕes do globo. Щ apresentada uma anсlise comparativa onde os parтmetros nњmero de planos orbitais, nњmero de satщlites por plano, longitude da ascensуo reta e inclinaчуo sуo variados visando identificar qual combinaчуo apresenta o maior percentual de atendimento aos requisitos de missуo. Diferentes orientaчѕes sуo tambщm apresentadas. Uma vez identificada a combinaчуo do nњmero de planos e nњmero de satщlite mais promissora щ efetuada uma o
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This research addresses a proposal for updating the Space Segment of the National Environmental Data System guided by Systems Engineering, with emphasis on coverage analysis of an orbital satellites system, named SCD N, intended to provide environmental data collection from ground data collecting platforms (PCDs) spread over the Brazilian territory, to provide on board data storage capacity and to transmit the data to a Ground Receiving Station during a convenient orbit passage over it. The data will be received in UHF frequency and be transmitted to ground in S-Band frequency. The SCD N will make use of just one S-Band transponder to receive telecommand and to transmit the payload data as well as its service telemetries, thus saving one UHF payload transmitter. The SCD N UHF and S-Band radioelectric frequencies interfaces have being specified to be full compliant with the ground segment of the already existing National Environmental Data System (SINDA), which was created and have been operated by the Brazilian National Institute for Space Research - INPE. The functional, operational and interface mission requirements are presented. Analyses are performed in order to demonstrate the main characteristics of the system in orbit. Studies are also performed in order to provide the definition of the orbital system SCDs N (number of satellites definition) in order to be able to acquire data from any platforms in the world as well as to be temporarily visible, for telecommunications purposes at ground stations positioned in global regions. The study comprises a comparative analysis where the parameters of number of orbital planes, number of satellites per plane, right ascension and inclination are varied to identify which combination has the highest percentage of meet the mission requirements. Different orientations are also presented. Once identified the best combination of orbital plans and number of satellites, an optimization is performed trying

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Banca reunida em 05 de dezembro de 2011, no auditorio Otto Weinbaum, no ITA, em Sao Jose dos Campos, mestrado da aluna Carolina D'Arrigo Vidal, orientada por Geilson Loureiro, banca presidida por Ligia Maria de Soto Urbina, examinador interno Milton de Chagas Freitas Jr., examinador externo Claudiano Salles de Araujo
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This thesis presents a method for space system mission analysis. It is based on a new systems engineering approach namely ?Enhanced Total View Framework (ETVF)?, which seeks the concurrent development of the product and organizations involved. ETVF is also described in this thesis and as the name suggests it is an enhancement of the ?Total View Framework?. The proposed method for space system mission analysis is called ?Total Mission Analysis for Space System (TMASS)?. It takes into account all space system life cycle, from the time the space system is qualified for use or operation to the time it is decommissioned or disposed of. Indeed, TMASS encompasses all the high-level procedures before, during and after the space system launching and operational phases. It includes space system non-operational and operational processes, comprising the development of the whole system where the space system is inserted. TMASS is applied to the Mission Analysis of the SARA Suborbital System. The results obtained by using the traditional approach are briefly compared with the results obtained by using the proposed method. TMASS is supposed to be applied in the earlier phase of a space system development. In addition, ETVF and TMASS intents are also to revive the logic behind the systems engineering activity which with time has become only a formality.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Banca de doutorado do aluno Adalberto Coelho reunida em 17 de outubro de 2011, no auditorio Otto Weinbaum, do ITA, orientador Geilson Loureiro. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The Satellite Assembly, Integration and Test (AIT) activities are a logical and interrelated sequence of events. The main objective in this phase of a space program development is to achieve a high degree of confidence that the Satellite complies with its specified performance parameters. It is verified that the interrelations of the process of AIT in the development of complex space systems ? satellites, either in the traditional way or that already employ simultaneous engineering; it does not contemplate in an appropriate form the participation of AIT in the phases of conception and detailing of project of the satellite. Considering that the involved costs and the time currently placed for AIT activities correspond approximately 15% and 25% respectively of the total of a space project and that shaping multiple aspects of a system in its cycle of life, this new vision of system project, offers to dramatic profits of productivity and quality of product. It is of fundamental importance to insert in the existing processes of modeling that they use the benefits of Simultaneous Engineering - ―Model Driven System Design‖, applied to the Space Projects, the requirements of Assembly, Integration and Testes (AIT) at the system level, since the phase of conception and detailing of project of the satellite. This means to develop a process to integrate the AIT requirements ? electrical, mechanical and environmental to the satellite development - Design for AIT. This doctoral program aims to propose a new process of development of satellites, to include requirements - electrical, mechanical and environmental of assembly, integration and testing (AIT) of satellites, at the system level, already at the design stage of the satellite project.

Resumo: As atividades de Montagem, Integraчуo e Testes (AIT -?Assembly, Integration and Test?) de um satщlite sуo uma seqќъncia lѓgica e inter-relacionada de eventos. O principal objetivo desta fase de desenvolvimento do programa espacial щ alcanчar um alto grau de confianчa que o satщlite estс em conformidade com os parтmetros de desempenho especificados. Verifica-se que as inter-relaчѕes do processo de AIT no desenvolvimento de sistemas espaciais complexos - satщlites, tanto na forma tradicional ou os que jс empregam a engenharia simultтnea, nуo contempla de forma adequada р participaчуo da AIT nas fases de concepчуo e detalhamento do projeto do satщlite. Contata-se que os custos envolvidos e o tempo que hoje se aloca para as atividades AIT correspondem acerca de 15% e 25% respectivamente, do total de um projeto espacial e que modelar vсrios aspectos de um sistema em seu ciclo de vida (nova visуo de projeto de sistema), oferece aumentos significativos de produtividade e qualidade do produto. Щ de fundamental importтncia, portanto inserir nos processos existentes de modelagem, que utilizam os benefэcios de Engenharia Simultтnea - "Model Driven System Design", aplicado aos projetos de sistemas espaciais, os requisitos de Montagem, Integraчуo e Testes (AIT) ao nэvel do sistema, desde a fase de concepчуo e detalhamento do projeto do satщlite. Isso significa desenvolver um processo para integrar os requisitos AIT ? elщtricos, mecтnicos e ambientais no desenvolvimento de satщlites - Design de AIT (D4AIT). Este programa de doutoramento tem por objetivo propor, um novo processo (D4AIT) de desenvolvimento de satщlites, que insira os requisitos (elщtricos, mecтnicos e ambientais) de montagem, integraчуo e testes (AIT -?Assembly, Integration and Test?), em nэvel de sistema, jс na fase de
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The Satellite Assembly, Integration and Test (AIT) activities are a logical and interrelated sequence of events. The main objective in this phase of a space program development is to achieve a high degree of confidence that the Satellite complies with its specified performance parameters. Considering that the involved costs and the time currently placed for AIT activities correspond approximately 15% and 25% respectively of the total of a space project and that shaping multiple aspects of a system in its cycle of life, this new vision of system project, offers to dramatic profits of productivity and quality of product. It is of fundamental importance to insert in the existing processes of modeling that they use the benefits of Simultaneous Engineering - ?Model Driven System Design?, applied to the Space Projects, the requirements of Assembly, Integration and Testes (AIT) at the system level, since the phase of conception and detailing of project of the satellite. This means to develop a process to integrate the AIT requirements ? electrical, mechanical and environmental to the satellite development - Design for AIT. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This thesis proposal is entitled "Method for diagnosis of capability and maturity of integrated systems management (Quality, Safety and Health, Environmental and Social Responsibility) in organizations that develop space activities in Brazil". The main purpose is to develop a diagnostic tool based on CMMI (Capability Maturity Model Integration) model which is internationally used for assessing organizations performing (Systems Engineering, Software Engineering and Integrated Product and Process Development). This method will be applied to LIT in order to be used as a standard diagnostic method in different space activities conducted in Brazil.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Banca reunida em 15 de novembro de 2011. O trabalho de graduacao foi feito apos um estagio do aluno no MIT (Massachusetts Institute of Technology). No MIT, o aluno foi orientado pelo Prof Dr Ricardo Valerdi. Ele estagiou no LAI (Lean Advancement Initiative) chefiada pela Profa Dra Debbie Nightingale. Os membros da banca do aluno foram listados acima.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This work aims to identify the main sources of error on the estimation of user story?s size during sprints of an agile project. The introduction of agile practices in software development requires a new approach to planning, an approach that embraces change and in fact supports it, making estimation even more challenging. As more software development companies adopt agile development as rationale for their core values, governance, planning, control and quality assurance must be refined and strengthened to drive better predictability and support coding. This work addresses this need by identifying sources of error on the estimation of user story?s size in a sprint from basically three aspects of an agile project: the team, the product and the company. In order to find these sources of error, the author compares two scenarios of agile software development: an academic experiment, which was found well documented in the literature; and a project at a private company, analyzed using a single-case research methodology conducted by the author. The author assesses quantitatively the accuracy of user story?s size estimate for each sprint in a project, by observing its relative error, looking for an unexpected behavior when comparing the company?s project to the academic experiment. Following, the author interviewed the company?s project team about potential changes that affected the teamand potentially led to the increase in the magnitude of relative error of user story?s size estimate seen in different moments of the project. The author found that throughout the project different events led to high magnitude of relative error on estimation of user story?s size: changes in scope of the project, optimism, poor experience with agile practices, poor experience with estimation techniques and inefficient communication with the customer.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Design and Process Science designates an innovative and transdisciplinary study and research area that consists of the integration of concepts, methods and tools used for modeling, simulation, automatization and management of processes and of their application to solve business process problems originated mainly from the service and industrial areas. This work proposes a Design and Process Science practical approach applied to a problem of the space area, based on the use of Unified Conceptual Modeling and of the joint application of simulation and business process management tools in the development of the complete model life cycle. The potentialities of the approach are demonstrated by its use on a real case study, the Integration and Testing Laboratory (LIT) of the National Space Research Institute (INPE), Brazil.
